content: Regulation is a fundamental government function, with federal agencies issuing thousands of rules annually on various topics. The costs of complying with these regulations are not included in the federal budget process. Some policymakers are interested in measuring total regulatory costs and benefits, as seen in the Congressional Office of Regulatory Analysis Creation and Sunset and Review Act of 2011. Congress has also required the Office of Management and Budget to report annually on the aggregate costs of regulations. The Congressional Office of Regulatory Analysis Creation and Sunset and Review Act of 2011 (H.R. 214, 112th Congress) would mandate the new office to issue an annual report on the total costs and benefits of existing Federal regulations.
